explains: adj. 自大的；骄傲的；过于自信的

sentences.en: They got very cocky, and went about saying you were done for this time!
sentences.cn: 他们非常自大，到处说你这次完蛋了！

sentences.en: He was a little bit cocky when he was about 11 because he was winning everything.
sentences.cn: 他11岁的时候有点自以为是，因为那时他无往不胜。

sentences.en: "Yes, he is rather cocky," Wendy admitted with regret.
sentences.cn: “是的，他相当傲慢。”温迪带着歉意承认。
